title: The Battle of Marathon has famously exercised the minds and imaginations of many commentators, with the German historian Eduard Meyer seeing the end of Greek civilization if the Persians had won the battle, John Stuart Mill regarding it as a more important event in English history than the Battle of Hastings and Robert Graves beginning his ‘The Persian Version’ with ‘Truth-loving Persians do not dwell upon / The trivial skirmish fought near Marathon’ – a perspective that finds support in the work of Pierre Briant: ‘from the Persian point of view, Marathon was nothing but a minor engagement that had no effect whatever on the Aegean strategy defined by Darius
